item.title: Game Theory Night with the John Nash Society | Oct. 8
item.description: Join the John Nash Society for our first Game Theory Night! Play fun strategy games, learn Game Trees, and see how John Nash’s ideas connect to everyday life. All majors welcome, no background needed. Pizza provided! Wed, Oct. 8 | 5:30–6:30 PM | Sa Lounge, 4th floor in the Pittsburgh Building.

item.title: Lally Rally | Oct. 15
item.description: Join Epsilon Delta Sigma for the Lally Rally on Wednesday, October 15th from 1–3 PM on the 5th Floor of the Pittsburgh Building. The event will feature a State of the School Address from Dean Wagman, interactive round table discussions, and a Mario Kart tournament. Food will be provided. Don’t miss this opportunity to engage with the Lally community, share your insights, and connect with fellow students in a fun and welcoming environment.

item.title: Robust Admission Via Two-Stage Matching under Ranking Uncertainty
item.description: Please join ISE for a Colloquium Speaker: Dr. Gustavo Angulo and his seminar on Robust Admission Via Two-Stage Matching under Ranking Uncertainty. Dr. Gustavo Angulo is an associate professor at the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering of Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile. His research interests are in mixed-integer programming and stochastic programming All Faculty and students are welcome to attend!

item.title: Fully Funded PhD Student Positions for Fall 2026 in Decision Sciences and Engineering Systems
item.description: The ISE Dept. is actively recruiting students with a strong background in engineering, mathematics, computer science, or other related fields. We offer fully funded PhD positions in optimization, data science, manufacturing systems, supply chain and logistics. We encourage you to attend our webinar on Nov. 7, 8:30 AM to 9:30 AM EST. All information session attendees will receive an application fee waiver. Webinar registration: https://apply.rpi.edu/register/ISE117

item.title: “Good Enough Art” Talk On October 9
item.description: Amid a historic decline of the middle class caused in part by the “missing middle” housing crisis, Anna Kornbluh (Professor of English, University of Illinois - Chicago) argues that cultural study must revamp its traditional sociological methods. Briefly considering architecture, photography, fiction, and television, this talk experiments with a formalist approach to mid aesthetics: “good enough art.” Join us Oct. 9 at 6:30pm in Sage 3303.

item.description: Date: Friday, October 10, 2025 4:30 PM - 7:30 PM - Rensselaer Voices for Palestine will be hosting a screening for the Oscar-winning film “No Other Land,” which documents the Israeli military’s destruction of the community of Masafer Yatta in the West Bank. item.title: Reduce and Reuse: Introducing the Chemical ReUse Program
item.description: RPI is committed to reducing chemical waste and promoting responsible resource management across campus. To advance these goals, Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) is launching a Chemical ReUse Program, a new initiative that helps laboratories share surplus chemicals and reduce disposal needs.
